original: Blomberg, Carl-Gustaf, major, Borås, f. 8/10/95 i Kinna, Älvsb. 1., av statiinsp. Claes B. o. Christina Eke-ilunidh. G. 31 m. Vanja Sayda Paulina Larson. Barn: Eric f. 32, Inger 35, Margit 39, Bertil 43. — Stud:ex. i Borås 15, off:ex. 17, GCI, KHS, SS. Fänrik v. Älvsb. reg. 17, undrlöjtn. 19, löjtn. 20, kapt. i reg. 32, major 41, v. Älvsb. reg. sed. 42. Stabschef v. Gbgs fo-stab 42-44. Hobbiies: tennis, simning, ridning, skjutning o. skidåkning. RSO, Svmifb GM m. krans, Väster-götl. tennisförb. förtj :GM, Borås lawntenniskl. förtj :GM, Älvsb. reg. idr:fören. förtj :GM, Älvsb. reg. skyt-tefören. förtj :GM, SkytteSM, Svmifb förtj :SM, Västergötl. idrrförb. förtj :-SM, Älvsb. skytteförb. förtj :SM, Skidfrämj. förtj :SM, erh. ett flert. märken o. plak. i guld o. silver.
translated: Blomberg, Carl-Gustaf, major, Borås, b. 8/10/95 in Kinna, Älvsborg county, son of railway inspector Claes B. and Christina Eke-ilunidh. Married in 1931 to Vanja Sayda Paulina Larson. Children: Eric b. 1932, Inger b. 1935, Margit b. 1939, Bertil b. 1943. Education: graduated from high school in Borås in 1915, military officer training in 1917, GCI, KHS, SS. Promotions: Second Lieutenant in the Älvsborg regiment in 1917, First Lieutenant in 1920, Captain in regiment 32, Major in 1941, vice commander in the Älvsborg regiment in 1942. Served as staff chief in the Gothenburg defense staff from 1942 to 1944. Hobbies: tennis, swimming, horseback riding, shooting and skiing. Awards and honors: Royal Order of the Sword (RSO), Swedish Military Sports Federation's gold medal with ribbon, Västergötland Tennis Association's merit award: gold medal, Borås Lawn Tennis Club's merit award: gold medal, Älvsborg regiment sports association's merit award: gold medal, Älvsborg regiment shooting association's merit award: gold medal, Shooting Swedish Championship medal, Swedish Military Sports Federation's merit award: silver medal, Västergötland Sports Association's merit award: silver medal, Älvsborg shooting association's merit award: silver medal, Ski Promotion's merit award: silver medal, and received several other gold and silver medals and plaques.
